title: Small Steps Still Count
content: Healing doesn't have to look dramatic. Small acts of courage matter.
author: GBV Awareness Team

title: Check On the ‘Strong’ Friend
content: The strongest-looking friend may also be silently struggling. Reach out with kindness.
author: Lerato Dlamini

title: It’s Okay to Have Boundaries
content: Boundaries protect your wellbeing. You are allowed to say no and take space.
author: Wellbeing & Care Collective

title: Remember to Breathe
content: When things feel overwhelming, slow breathing can help calm the body and mind.
author: Mindfulness Circle

title: You Are Not to Blame
content: Survivors often carry unfair guilt. This post encourages self-compassion and reassurance.
author: GBV Support Network

title: Find Your Safe People
content: Healing grows in supportive community. This post explores how to find emotionally safe relationships.
author: Care Collective

title: Listening Gently
content: Sometimes the best support is simply listening without fixing or judging.
author: Healing Conversations

title: It’s Okay to Have Slow Days
content: Not every day will be productive. Rest is part of the healing process.
author: Wellbeing Collective

title: Reaching Out Takes Courage
content: Even asking for small help is a brave step. Celebrate that courage.
author: Support Desk

title: You Deserve Peace
content: Everyone deserves a life free from fear. This is your reminder.
author: GBV Awareness Team
